sense.name: a written list of particular things being offered
sense.examples: Nothing appealed to me on the new bistro's bill of fare. John isn't on the bill of this production of The Tempest.

sense.name: a written notice that announces or advertises something
sense.examples: Post no bills on this wall. Who dropped those advertising bills all over the street?

sense.name: a statute or draft not yet become law
sense.examples: I don't think this bill will pass in the Senate. Mary introduced a new highway safety bill last week.

sense.name: an itemized statement of money owed
sense.examples: My heating bill this month seems really high. I sent my client a bill for two thousand dollars for work I completed since August.

sense.name: a printed note that is legal tender
sense.examples: John flashed a hundred dollar bill at the waiter. Take these stacks of bills and deposit them in the bank. Do you think this bill looks counterfeit?

sense.name: the mouth of a bird
sense.examples: Woodpeckers use their bills to extract insects from inside tree bark. The rooster pecked my hand with his sharp bill.

sense.name: a long-handled saw
sense.examples: The gardener used a bill to prune branches off the dogwood trees.

sense.name: brim of a hat that projects forward, visor
sense.examples: The teenager wore the bill of his cap backwards. I like this hat with the long bill because it keeps the sun out of my eyes.

sense.name: the point of a ship anchor's fluke
sense.examples: John didn't realize the bill of the anchor fluke had struck hard coral.
